title: Panic while compiling generic struct that wraps a closure, on borrow checking analysis.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Hi, I'm new to Rust and I've managed to blow something up - sorry! Otherwise I've been having a lot of fun learning the language :-) While I'm here reporting this panic, would someone mind clarifying to me what is the most idiomatic way to accept a closure of any type (FnOnce, Fn, and FnMut). I read somewhere that FnOnce was sort of the trait that all of the closures would implement regardless - does that mean I can use that alone to accept any closure (assuming the `mut` and `&` matches)? My attempt caused a rustc panic, as seen below: ### Code ```Rust struct Callback<'a, T> { callback: &'a mut dyn FnOnce() -> T, } impl<'a, T> Callback<'a, T> { pub fn new(callback: &'a mut dyn FnOnce() -> T) -> Callback<'a, T> { Callback { callback } } } #[cfg(test)] mod tests { use super::*; #[test] fn can_wrap_fnonce() { let x = 0; let fn_once = || x; let callback = Callback::new(&mut fn_once); } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.51.0 (2fd73fabe 2021-03-23) binary: rustc commit-hash: 2fd73fabe469357a12c2c974c140f67e7cdd76d0 commit-date: 2021-03-23 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.51.0 LLVM version: 11.0.1 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'LocalTableInContext: key not found', compiler\rustc_mir\src\borrow_check\diagnostics\mutability_errors.rs:512:30 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.51.0 (2fd73fabe 2021-03-23) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [mir_borrowck] borrow-checking `graph::callback::tests::can_wrap_fnonce` #1 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack warning: 4 warnings emitted error: could not compile `game-renderer` To learn more, run the command again with --verbose. ```
